meanings.sent1: The teacher dismissed the student's hogwashes during class.
meanings.sent2: I don't have time for your hogwashes; I need to focus on my work.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's hogwashes had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was just a pile of hogwashes that nobody believed.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was full of hogwashes, trying to deceive the public.

meanings.definition: Worthless or trivial ideas or information
meanings.sent1: She ignored the hogwashes in the tabloids and focused on real news.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was unproductive due to all the hogwashes being discussed.
meanings.sent3: His excuses for being late were nothing but hogwashes.
meanings.sent4: The book was filled with hogwashes, lacking any meaningful content.
meanings.sent5: Don't waste your time on such hogwashes; focus on what truly matters.
